title: Sunset, Coleman Hollow
credit_line: Gift of Sara M. Winokur and James L. Winokur
provenance_text:
John Kane [1860-1934], Pittsburgh, PA. M. Knoedler & Co., London, England, 1936 [1]; Cecil Beaton [1904-1980], London, England, 1936; M. Knoedler & Co., New York, NY, as agent, May 2, 1961 until May 3, 1963 [2]; M. Knoedler & Co, New York NY, May 3, 1963 until July 1964 [3]; James L. Winokur [1922-2009] and Sara M. Winokur, Pittsburgh, PA, July 1964 until December 9, 1976 [4]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1976.

Notes:
[1]. Knoedler, London provenance from "American Paintings and Sculpture to 1945 in the Carnegie Museum of Art," pages 285-286. However, the painting is apparently not in the 1936 stock books of the London branch of the company. Perhaps Knoedler acted as agent.
[2]. On consignment from Mr. Beaton, Knoedler stock no. CA 6114.
[3]. The painting was taken into stock by Knoedler, New York on May 3, 1963 as stock no. A8507 at a cost of $2,500.
[4]. Mr. Winokur was billed for the painting ($7,800) in July 1964, though the purchase was dated March 23, 1964. See copies of relevant information in curatorial file for notes [2], [3], and [4], obtained from the Knoedler Gallery Archive, The Getty Research Institute.

creator.birth_place: West Calder (West Lothian, Scotland, United Kingdom)
